headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Wrong That 2 Killed During Obama Speech
headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Wrong That 2 Killed During Obama Speech

docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump incorrectly claimed in a television interview that two people were shot and killed in Chicago during then-President Barack Obama's farewell speech.
docs.snippet: President Donald Trump incorrectly claimed in a television interview that two people were shot and killed in Chicago during then-President Barack Obama's farewell speech....

headline.main: For-Profit Schools, an Obama Target, See New Day Under Trump
headline.print_headline: New Optimism in Education’s Profit Industry

docs.lead_paragraph: The Education Department, whose scrutiny has led hundreds of campuses to close, is now led by Betsy DeVos, who has investments in the industry.
docs.snippet: The Education Department, whose scrutiny has led hundreds of campuses to close, is now led by Betsy DeVos, who has investments in the industry....

headline.main: DC Shop Paints Over Mural With Cosby, Obama; New Mural Soon
headline.print_headline: DC Shop Paints Over Mural With Cosby, Obama; New Mural Soon

docs.lead_paragraph: A landmark restaurant in the nation's capital has painted over a mural on one of its outside walls that depicted Bill Cosby and now former President Barack Obama, among other figures.
docs.snippet: A landmark restaurant in the nation's capital has painted over a mural on one of its outside walls that depicted Bill Cosby and now former President Barack Obama, among other figures....

headline.main: As Obama Era Closes, Goal to End Veteran Homelessness Unmet
headline.print_headline: As Obama Era Closes, Goal to End Veteran Homelessness Unmet

docs.lead_paragraph: Pledges by President Barack Obama and a national nonprofit organization to end homelessness among veterans did not meet their goal. But advocates see improvement, and the head of the Department of Veterans Affairs said Thursday that "we should be there" within a couple of years.

headline.main: Obama Pens Law Review Article on Criminal Justice Challenges
headline.print_headline: Obama Pens Law Review Article on Criminal Justice Challenges

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama returned to his roots at the Harvard Law Review on Thursday, penning an article about progress his administration made in reforming the criminal justice system — and the challenges that remain for the next administration.

headline.main: U.S. Ambassadors Appointed by Obama Must Quit by Inauguration Day
headline.print_headline: U.S. Ambassadors Appointed by Obama Must Quit by Inauguration Day

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's transition team has issued a blanket mandate for politically appointed ambassadors installed by President Barack Obama to leave their posts by Inauguration Day, the U.S. ambassador to New Zealand said on Friday.

headline.main: Pressure on Obama to Grant Last-Minute Pardons, Commutations
headline.print_headline: Pressure on Obama to Grant Last-Minute Pardons, Commutations

docs.lead_paragraph: Under increasing pressure to free convicts as a last act, President Barack Obama is planning at least one more batch of pardons and commutations before leaving office in two weeks, but don't expect many famous offenders to make the list.
docs.snippet: Under increasing pressure to free convicts as a last act, President Barack Obama is planning at least one more batch of pardons and commutations before leaving office in two weeks, but don't expect many famous offenders to make the list....

headline.main: Obama to Deliver Farewell Address in Chicago on January 10
headline.print_headline: Obama to Deliver Farewell Address in Chicago on January 10

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama will deliver a farewell address on Jan. 10 to reflect on his time in office and say thank you to his supporters, he said in an email statement released on Monday.
docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama will deliver a farewell address on Jan. 10 to reflect on his time in office and say thank you to his supporters, he said in an email statement released on Monday....

headline.main: Without Obama, Shinzo Abe’s Approach to U.S.-Japan Ties May Be Tested
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Departure Puts Japan’s Alliance With the United States at a Crossroad

docs.abstract: Japan's relationship to United States and place in Pacific region has been thrown into uncertainty with departure of Pres Obama and impending presidency of Donald Trump, who has promised to destroy Trans-Pacific Partnership championed by Obama and Pers Shinzo Abe and has hinted at more aggressive stance against China.
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump brings uncertainty to the alliance, grumbling about trade and the cost of U.S. military support, and raising the specter of a more confrontational approach to China.
docs.snippet: Donald Trump brings uncertainty to the alliance, grumbling about trade and the cost of U.S. military support, and raising the specter of a more confrontational approach to China....
